ActionsType.Name: Polled
ActionsType.Description: This message is a command use to query or set a value

ActionsType.Name: Announce
ActionsType.Description: This message may be sent by the device at any time to report a value

ActionsType.Name: Both
ActionsType.Description: This message may be sent by the device at any time to report a value, or a used to query or set a value

Formats.Name: String
Formats.Description: String of any valid Language of Things data characters

Formats.Name: ONOFFTOG
Formats.Description: Either ON, OFF or TOG. (TOG switches the current value between ON or OFF)

Formats.Name: ID
Formats.Description: Two character device ID of any valid Language of Things ID characters

Formats.Name: ReadOnlyHex
Formats.Description: Hexadecimal value that can only be read

Formats.Name: Period
Formats.Description: Period of time represented as 3 digit value and period multiplier of T(milli seconds), S(seconds), M(minutes), H(hours), D(days)

Formats.Name: SleepMode
Formats.Description:
Sleep mode represented as one of the follow. Sleep Off = 0 
 Interrupt = 8 
 Cyclic = 16 
 Polled = 32

Formats.Name: ENKey
Formats.Description: Hexadecimal string when sent to a radio, ACK in response

Formats.Name: ALRTOFF
Formats.Description: Alert state for off for normal state, Either ALRT or OFF (boolean)

Generic Commands.Description: Sent as a general acknowledegment of an incoming announcement message.
Request Language of Things protocol version.

Request the device type for Languages of Things protocol version 1.x devices.
 Response is a nine character device type e.g. aXXU00000001 Device types beginning with U are reserved for users to assign to their own prototype devices. All other device types will be kept on a register by CISECO Ltd and will be update on a regular basis. In Language of Things Protocol version 1.1 this was changed to a eight character field e.g. aXXU0000001-

Request the device type for Languages of Things protocol version 2.x devices.
 A registry of DTY's is held by CISECO Ltd and will be update on a regular basis.

Request the manufacturer device name for Languages of Things protocol version 1.x devices.
Response is a nine character “friendly” name.
Request the manufacturer device name for Languages of Things protocol version 2.x devices

Request the device manufacturer ID
 000001 = CISECO
Request the device variant information.
Request the device to acknowledge it’s there.

Request the serial number of Languages of Things protocol version 1.x devices.
 Also used to set serial number, can only be done once after sending $ER command
Initiate Serial number update (as retrieved and set via the SER command). Can be only used once. For Languages of Things protocol version 1.x devices
Request the manufacturer serial number HIGH Bytes
Request the manufacturer serial number LOW Bytes
Turn Encryption On or OFF
Set 1st set of three bytes of the Encryption Key. Unlike other commands the reply will be an EN1ACK
Set 2nd set of three bytes of the Encryption Key. Unlike other commands the reply will be an EN2ACK
Set 3rd set of three bytes of the Encryption Key. Unlike other commands the reply will be an EN3ACK
Set 4th set of three bytes of the Encryption Key. Unlike other commands the reply will be an EN4ACK
Set 5th set of three bytes of the Encryption Key. Unlike other commands the reply will be an EN5ACK
Set last byte of the Encryption Key. Unlike other commands the reply will be an EN6ACK
Request the manufacturer firmware version
Request the current device ID or set a new one

Requests the current PANID or set a new one (the id of the channel the device listens to). PANID is a four character hexadecimal number on Ciseco wireless networks. All devices within the same PANID can communicate with each other. The change will only take place when the device is reset or powered on/off.
Request that the device reboots itself, This saves the current device configuration to non volatile memory.

Set the amount of retries for 'Announcement' messages, default is 5 (number can be 00-99). After an Announcement messages sent the radio listens for 50 milliseconds. If an ACK message is received the device will go back to sleep, otherwise the message the device tries again.
Request battery level in Volts

Requests the device sleep for a period of time. After which the device will return to an AWAKE state
 For Interrupt sleeping devices a command with no period aXXSLEEP---- will cause the device to sleep permanently until woken by an external interrupt e.g. A button press
Save the current device configuration to non volatile memory.

Reset all device configurations values that can be changed via Language of Things messages to the default values. The values are not saved to the config, SAVE or REBOOT commands will be needed to make the changes permanent.
Exit config mode resetting working ID to the stored ID, any config changes are not saved
Enter config mode, the device will go into CONFIGME just as if the config button had been pressed

Set and return the sleep mode. Represented as one of the following.
 Sleep Off = 0 
 Interrupt = 8 
 Cyclic = 16 
 Polled = 32
Request an RSSI reading from the device, Returns a negative dBm RSSI of the RSSI enquiry message when received

Cyclic Commands.Description: Sets the sleep interval between reading periods
Start cyclic sleeping mode (only applies to cyclic sleeping devices)
Wake a sleeping device, use to get out of cyclic sleep
Change how often a sleeping device reports its battery reading and wake opportunity

Announcements.Description: This is to notify the hub that a device has just started. The hub can then add the device back into the list of active devices.
This is to notify that something unexpected happened at the device and that should be investigated. The nnnn can be used by the manufacturer to denote what type of error occurred.
Device is going to sleep (only applies to devices that support sleep).
Device is now awake and listening for commands, for 100 milliseconds. A device can be kept awake by sending a WAKE command.
Device battery is low (only applies to battery powered devices).
A device is in configuration mode.

Sleep Modes.Description: Cyclic sleeping devices sleep for a period of time, then wake up, send a reading and go back to sleep, starting the cycle over again. The length of the sleep period is set via the INTVL command. After a number of wakes (as set by WAKEC) it will also send an AWAKE message and a BATT reading and then listen for 100 milliseconds, if no message is received the device sends a SLEEPING message and returns to sleep.
Interrupt sleeping device will sleep until an external interrupt is received. e.g. A button press
Polled sleeping device can be told to sleep for a period of time (SLEEP command), after which they will return to an awake state.
